question: Is it ok for a non-mahram man to stay (for an extended period) at a house where females of the family reside?
answer:
QUESTION

A freind of my father's has recently come from abroad to stay with us. There are women in the house, and for this reason, we (except my father) believe that allowing a ghair mardh to stay is islamically infeasable as it places restrictions upon the women in the house (ie, the need to observe hijab throuhout the duration of his stay in their own home). We have asked my father to put his freind up at a Bed & Breakfast throughout his stay, but he (my father) has thus far declined. My mother is, rightly so I believe, uncomfortable with the present circumstance. I firmly believe that the suitability of this arrangment compromises on the basic islamic principles of purdah. Should my father respect the wishes of the women in the house and politely ask his freind to stay elsewhere? He will be staying for a week.

ANSWER


Share:

If your mother and the other womanfolk sacrifice being in Purdah then your father will be able to honour his friend by keeping him in the house. If the womanfolk cannot make that sacrifice, then your father should consider the issue of Purdah and Hijaab of the womanfolk and make other suitable living arrangements for his friend. The womanfolk should also consider your fatherâ€™s respect in front of his friend.

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
